description:
Marginally paid employees

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
53111 Census of crafts

Definition:
Marginally paid employees include all employees pursuing an
occupation pursuant to Section 8 (1) of the Social Code,
Book IV. In reference year 2015, an employee was marginally
paid pursuant to Section 8 (1) of the Social Code, Book IV
if his/her remuneration from employment was regularly 450
euros per month or less.
These data, too, are provided by the Federal Employment
Agency to the Federal Statistical Office in accordance with
the Act on the Use of Administrative Data. The data cover
the establishments in which, on an annual average from
reference year 2014, a specific number of employees subject
to social insurance contributions or of marginally paid
persons have been employed.
For the evaluation, the Federal Employment Agency provides
reference-date values as at the end of any month. The tables
containing results of the census of crafts show annual
averages. The annual average is calculated as the arithmetic
mean of the reference-date values.
The data on marginally employed persons of the
establishments are also aggregated to obtain enterprise
results.
